I am a Atmospheric Scientist based in Fort Collins, Colorado.




Cloud & Storm Structure ‚Äì Unraveling the 3D features of clouds and storms.

Mesoscale Convective Processes ‚Äì Understanding the environmental controls on clouds and storms.

Weather‚ÄìClimate Interface ‚Äì Connecting short-term extremes with long-term climate trends.
Aviation ‚Äì Building tools for cloud-related aviation applications.






Data Integration and Analysis ‚Äì Combining remote-sensing observations and numerical models.
Machine Learning ‚Äì Extracting patterns and mechanisms within clouds and the environments.
Software Development ‚Äì Creating scalable, open-source packages for research and applications.
‚ÄúThe first step in solving any problem is recognizing there is one.‚Äù
I integrate remote-sensing observations, numerical modeling, and machine learning to reveal the processes that shape storms in a changing environment.
My work advances scientific understanding while improving operational safety. Through rigorous science and scalable software tools, I transform complex atmospheric insights into practical solutions that strengthen safety, resilience, and decision-making for both professionals and the public in a changing atmosphere.

title: Hungjui Yu
section: Decoding Clouds, Storms, and the Skies We Fly Through
text:
Decoding Clouds, Storms, and the Skies We Fly Through
I study the 3D structure of clouds and storms, blending atmospheric science and machine learning to reveal patterns that shape weather and climate, and to create tools that make aviation safer for professionals and the public alike.

title: Hungjui Yu
text: I am Hungjui Yu (Â∞§ËôπÂè°), a researcher in Atmospheric Science based in Fort Collins, Colorado.

title: Hungjui Yu
text:
üå©Ô∏è Research at a Glance



Cloud & Storm Structure ‚Äì Unraveling the 3D organization of clouds and storms.

Mesoscale Processes ‚Äì Studying the environmental drivers of convective weather.

Weather‚ÄìClimate Interface ‚Äì Linking short-term weather patterns to longer-term climate impacts.




Machine Learning Applications ‚Äì Extracting hidden patterns from atmospheric data.

Aviation Safety Tools ‚Äì Cloud-Free Line-of-Sight (CFLOS) and lightning hazard assessment.

Scalable Software ‚Äì Building tools that turn research into real-world solutions.

title: Hungjui Yu
text:
üîç What Drives My Work
I combine remote-sensing observations, numerical modeling, and machine learning to uncover the physical and statistical patterns that shape storms and their environments.
This research enhances both scientific understanding and operational safety‚Äîsupporting pilots, forecasters, and the public through improved hazard assessment and decision-making.

title: Hungjui Yu
text:
üöÄ Featured Projects

CFLOS Toolbox ‚Äì Software to estimate cloud-free lines of sight for aviation planning.

Lightning Hazard Mapping ‚Äì Integrating satellite, radar, and environmental data for lightning risk assessment.

Storm Mode Classification ‚Äì Using ML to identify and predict convective storm structures.



‚ÄúThe first step in solving any problem is recognizing there is one.‚Äù

title: Hungjui Yu
text: I am Hungjui Yu (Â∞§ËôπÂè°), a researcher in Atmospheric Science based in Fort Collins, Colorado.

title: Hungjui Yu
text:
Research
My work explores the 3-dimensional structure of clouds and storms, the mesoscale convective and environmental processes that shape them, and their role at the weather‚Äìclimate interface.
I integrate environmental data analysis from remote-sensing observations and numerical models with machine learning techniques to uncover patterns and mechanisms within clouds and their environments. I also develop aviation-focused tools to better address and understand storm-related risks.
By combining rigorous science with scalable software tools, I translate complex atmospheric insights into practical solutions that enhance safety, resilience, and decision-making for both the public and professional communities in a changing atmosphere.
‚ÄúThe first step in solving any problem is recognizing there is one.‚Äù
